original: @1b #// rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b #// rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya gha na by'u ha n'a ma mah'a y'a na s'u tra /
analyzed: a'arya gha na by'u ha n'a ma mah'a y'a na s'u tra /
translated: Arya-Ghanavyūha-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa rgyan stug po bkod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa rgyan stug po bkod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: The Noble Great Vehicle Sūtra called The Dense Array

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Part One

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas!

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time:

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba 'dod pa dang / gzugs @2a #//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba 'dod pa dang / gzugs @2a #//
translated: The Blessed One, the Lord of all phenomena, having transcended the realms of desire, form,

original: dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams las 'das te /
analyzed: dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams las 'das te /
translated: and formlessness, and the beings without perception,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po na stobs mnga' ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyis rnam par 'phrul zhing rjes su spyod pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po na stobs mnga' ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyis rnam par 'phrul zhing rjes su spyod pa /
translated: in the Dense Array Buddhafield, the powerful ones, manifesting and engaging in conduct through the bases of miraculous power,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnal 'byor dam pa'i rnal 'byor can 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnal 'byor dam pa'i rnal 'byor can 'di lta ste /
translated: the Bodhisattva Mahasattvas of supreme yoga, namely:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mur 'dug byed pa thams cad kyi gzhung rnam par 'joms pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' @2b sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mur 'dug byed pa thams cad kyi gzhung rnam par 'joms pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' @2b sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa dang /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūrilāṅgūla, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahāmati, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Buddha­dharma­vyavasthāna­yathābhūta­darśaka,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mthu chen po brnyes pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyal po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mthu chen po brnyes pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyal po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahāsthāmaprāpta, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vikurvaṇarāja, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par grol ba'i zla ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shugs 'dzin dang / de dag la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba bye ba snyed kyi byang chub @3a #//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par grol ba'i zla ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shugs 'dzin dang / de dag la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba bye ba snyed kyi byang chub @3a #//
translated: and so on—ten hundred thousand quintillion bodhisattva mahāsattvas as numerous as the atoms of ten buddha realms—

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po khams gsum pa'i yul las yongs su 'das pa /
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po khams gsum pa'i yul las yongs su 'das pa /
translated: who had transcended the domain of the three realms,

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi'i spyod yul las yongs su 'das pa /
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi'i spyod yul las yongs su 'das pa /
translated: who had transcended the domain of mind, thought, cognition, and the ground of all,

original: ye shes dang yid kyi lus su gnas gyur pa; sgyu ma lta bu dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba dang / chos kyi sprin gyi sa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ye shes dang yid kyi lus su gnas gyur pa; sgyu ma lta bu dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba dang / chos kyi sprin gyi sa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa /
translated: who had attained the body of wisdom and mind, who had attained the illusory, heroic, and cloud of Dharma stages and samādhis,

original: sangs rgyas du ma'i phyag gi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas du ma'i phyag gi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba /
translated: who had been empowered by the hands of many buddhas,🔽and

original: khams gsum pa'i yul las shin tu 'das pa'i gzhal med khang gi padmo chen po la 'khod pa rnams dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i yul las shin tu 'das pa'i gzhal med khang gi padmo chen po la 'khod pa rnams dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
translated: He was dwelling together with those who were seated on the great lotus in the palace that completely transcends the objects of the three realms.

original: de na mur 'dug dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyu ba med do //
analyzed: de na mur 'dug dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyu ba med do //
translated: There was no movement of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mthong ba'i @3b chos la bde bar spyod pa bdag gi so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis mkhyen pa'i spyod yul btsun par dbyangs 'byin pa sna tshogs kyi🔽gzugs du ma ston ba'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mthong ba'i @3b chos la bde bar spyod pa bdag gi so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis mkhyen pa'i spyod yul btsun par dbyangs 'byin pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs du ma ston ba'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha, who experiences happiness in the present life, arose from the samadhi called The Pure Melody of the Noble Wisdom Known by Oneself, which is the domain of the one who teaches the Dharma.

original: bzhengs nas kyang pho brang 'ja' dang glog gi 'od can rgyan dang / lta ba lhub du mas brgyan pa nas mngon par byung ste /
analyzed: bzhengs nas kyang pho brang 'ja' dang glog gi 'od can rgyan dang / lta ba lhub du mas brgyan pa nas mngon par byung ste /
translated: He arose from that samadhi and emerged from the palace called The Light of the Rainbow and Lightning, which was adorned with many ornaments and jewels.

original: zla ba dri ma med pa'i snying po zhes bya ba'i khang steng du gshegs so //
analyzed: zla ba dri ma med pa'i snying po zhes bya ba'i khang steng du gshegs so //
translated: He went to the upper floor of the palace called The Essence of the Stainless Moon.

original: gshegs nas kyang stug po'i ris kyi rgyan seng+ge'i gdan dam pa la byang chub sems dpa' dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: gshegs nas kyang stug po'i ris kyi rgyan seng+ge'i gdan dam pa la byang chub sems dpa' dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs so //
translated: Having arrived, he sat on the excellent lion throne of the adornments of the Akaniṣṭha realm, together with the bodhisattvas.

original: bzhugs nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis phyogs bzhir gzigs te gtsug gi rin chen 'od kyi rgyan ces bya ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs chen po'i 'od zer stong phrag brgya'i 'khor can smin mtshams nas byung ste /
analyzed: bzhugs nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis phyogs bzhir gzigs te gtsug gi rin chen 'od kyi rgyan ces bya ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs chen po'i 'od zer stong phrag brgya'i 'khor can smin mtshams nas byung ste /
translated: Having sat down, the Blessed One looked in the four directions and emitted from his forehead a great mass of light rays called the Adornment of the Light of the Crown Jewel, accompanied by a retinue of a hundred thousand light rays.

original: 'od zer gyi tshogs de byung bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rgyan gcig dang 'dra bar yongs su snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi tshogs de byung bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rgyan gcig dang 'dra bar yongs su snang bar gyur to //
translated: When that mass of light rays emerged, all the adornments of the buddha realms appeared as if they were a single adornment of the Buddha.

original: mchog tu phra ba'i rdul gyi phra ba nyid du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rang bzhin phra ba nyid kyang yongs su snang ngo //
analyzed: mchog tu phra ba'i rdul gyi phra ba nyid du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rang bzhin phra ba nyid kyang yongs su snang ngo //
translated: The finest particles of dust, the finest nature of all buddha realms, also appeared.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po'ang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan gyi rang bzhin rdul gyi phra ba nyid las 'das te gnas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po'ang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan gyi rang bzhin rdul gyi phra ba nyid las 'das te gnas so //
translated: The buddhafield of the Dense Array is beyond the nature of other buddhafields, beyond even the most subtle particles.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po ni 'od dang / gza' dang / zla ba spangs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po ni 'od dang / gza' dang / zla ba spangs pa ste /
translated: The buddhafield of the Dense Array is beyond light, planets, and the moon.

original: @4a *// 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis shin tu phra ba'i rdul gyi phra ba nyid du mi snang gi /
analyzed: @4a *// 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis shin tu phra ba'i rdul gyi phra ba nyid du mi snang gi /
translated: It is not visible as the most subtle particles, because of its unconditioned nature.

original: gzhan du mya ngan las 'das pa dang / nam mkha' dang ma brtags par 'gog pa lta bur byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag na spyod pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis gzigs so //
analyzed: gzhan du mya ngan las 'das pa dang / nam mkha' dang ma brtags par 'gog pa lta bur byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag na spyod pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis gzigs so //
translated: However, it is seen by those bodhisattva great beings, by the blessed buddhas, and by the bodhisattva great beings who are practicing in other buddhafields, like nirvāṇa, space, and non-analytical cessation.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu phyung ba de dag gzigs nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu phyung ba de dag gzigs nas /
translated: Then, the Lord, having seen the adornments of the buddha-fields and the emanations of the powers of the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis phyogs bcur byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dang bcas pa la gzigs nas byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis phyogs bcur byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dang bcas pa la gzigs nas byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: with his buddha-eye looked at the bodhisattvas in the ten directions together with their retinues, and said to the bodhisattva who teaches the arrangement of all the buddha-dharmas just as they are:

original: rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa /
analyzed: rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa /
translated: “Teach the arrangement just as it is,

original: stug po'i rgyan zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can du gtogs pa'i gzugs sred pa dang / ma rig pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu ye shes kyi mes rnam par bsregs te gnas @4b gyur pa'i phyir ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: stug po'i rgyan zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di na 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can du gtogs pa'i gzugs sred pa dang / ma rig pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu ye shes kyi mes rnam par bsregs te gnas @4b gyur pa'i phyir ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: In this buddha realm called Dense Adornment, the craving for form, the ignorance, and the meditative absorption of beings belonging to the desire, form, and formless realms, as well as those without conceptualization, have been burned away by the fire of wisdom that is the result of meditative absorption.

original: yid bzhin gyi lus stobs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang gis brgyan pa /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi lus stobs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang gis brgyan pa /
translated: They are adorned with wisdom, meditative absorption, a wish-fulfilling body, strength, superknowledge, miraculous powers, and mastery.

original: gseb med pa; ring du gnas pa /
analyzed: gseb med pa; ring du gnas pa /
translated: They are without gaps, and they remain for a long time.

original: zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / nor bu dang / glog dang / 'ja' dang / byu ru dang / ba bla dang / ldong ros dang / mtshal dang / mgo nag gi 'bru dang / kingshu ka dang / aindra go pa dang / gser dang /
analyzed: zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / nor bu dang / glog dang / 'ja' dang / byu ru dang / ba bla dang / ldong ros dang / mtshal dang / mgo nag gi 'bru dang / kingshu ka dang / aindra go pa dang / gser dang /
translated: They are adorned with the moon, the sun, jewels, lightning, rainbows, coral, conch shells, red arsenic, vermilion, black sesame seeds, kiṃśuka flowers, indragopa gems, and gold.

original: tsam pa ka dang / padmo dang / dung dang / rma bya'i mgul dang / mdongs bu me long gi nang na 'dug pa'i gzugs brnyan lta bu thob nas /
analyzed: tsam pa ka dang / padmo dang / dung dang / rma bya'i mgul dang / mdongs bu me long gi nang na 'dug pa'i gzugs brnyan lta bu thob nas /
translated: Having attained the state of being like a reflection in a mirror of a campaka flower, a lotus, a conch, a peacock's neck, or a parrot,

original: sa dang sar zag pa med pas sbyangs pa'i rgyu ting nge 'dzin la dbang sgyur ba'i phyir smon lam gyi mthar phyin pa bcu'i bsngo bas lus thob pa'i khyad par can dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug por 'ong ngo //
analyzed: sa dang sar zag pa med pas sbyangs pa'i rgyu ting nge 'dzin la dbang sgyur ba'i phyir smon lam gyi mthar phyin pa bcu'i bsngo bas lus thob pa'i khyad par can dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug por 'ong ngo //
translated: they come to the buddhafield of Ghanavyūha, having attained a special body by means of the dedications of the ten perfections, which are the causes of purification by way of the uncontaminated states in the grounds and grounds.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa stan las langs te /🔽bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa stan las langs te / bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva who teaches the arrangement of all the qualities of the Buddha just as they are arose from his seat,🔽put his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas phyag btsal te /🔽bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas phyag btsal te / bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: With palms joined he bowed to the Blessed One🔽and said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la @5a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la @5a *//
translated: to the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha,

original: phyogs gcig cig bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la zhu ba zhus pa lung bstan pa'i slad du skabs dbye bar gnang na bdag gis zhu'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig cig bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la zhu ba zhus pa lung bstan pa'i slad du skabs dbye bar gnang na bdag gis zhu'o //
translated: if the Lord would grant me the opportunity to ask a question, I would like to put a question to the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la dris shig dang / ngas ci dang ci 'dod pa de dang de'i dri ba dris pa lung bstan pas sems mgu bar bya'i /
analyzed: rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la dris shig dang / ngas ci dang ci 'dod pa de dang de'i dri ba dris pa lung bstan pas sems mgu bar bya'i /
translated: “You who teach the arrangement of things as they really are, ask the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha whatever you wish, and I will gratify your mind by answering your questions.”

original: khyod kyis ji ltar bzod pa de ltar smros shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis ji ltar bzod pa de ltar smros shig /
translated: “Speak as you wish.”

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par dgod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par dgod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Teaching the Arrangement of All Buddha Qualities as It Is

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs phye ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs phye ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When the Lord had given him leave, he said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po 'ba' zhig 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can las 'das te gnas sam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po 'ba' zhig 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can las 'das te gnas sam /
translated: is the Buddha-field of the Buddha Akṣobhya the only one that is exclusively delightful, and that is beyond the world-spheres of desire, form, and formlessness, and beyond the realm of non-perception?

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag kyang de bzhin nam ci lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag kyang de bzhin nam ci lags /
translated: Or are there other Buddha-fields like it?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po 'ba' zhig 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can las 'das te gnas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po 'ba' zhig 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can las 'das te gnas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: there is not only the Buddha-field of the Buddha Akṣobhya that is exclusively delightful, and that is beyond the world-spheres of desire, form, and formlessness, and beyond the realm of non-perception.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan @5b dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan @5b dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are other Buddha-fields like it.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

original: 'di nas pha rol la shin tu'ang pha rol sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba stong phrag brgya 'das pa'i steng gi phyogs cha na tshangs pa'i dbyangs de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin du s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa dang /
analyzed: 'di nas pha rol la shin tu'ang pha rol sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba stong phrag brgya 'das pa'i steng gi phyogs cha na tshangs pa'i dbyangs de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin du s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa dang /
translated: “Beyond that, far beyond, in the direction above, there is a buddhafield called Brahmā’s Melody, where the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Brahmā’s Melody resides.🔽“Beyond that, far beyond, there is a buddhafield called King of the Sāl Tree, where the thus-gone King of the Sāl Tree resides.🔽“Beyond that, far beyond, there is a buddhafield called King of the Stars, where the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha King of the Stars resides.

original: skar ma'i rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi pha rol shin tu'ang pha rol tu 'das pa na /
analyzed: skar ma'i rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi pha rol shin tu'ang pha rol tu 'das pa na /
translated: “Beyond that, far beyond, there are the buddhafields of the blessed buddhas, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba stong phrag brgya mang po byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi tshogs kyis brgyan pa shin tu yangs shing che ba dag yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba stong phrag brgya mang po byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi tshogs kyis brgyan pa shin tu yangs shing che ba dag yod de /
translated: There are many hundreds of thousands of millions of buddhafields that are very vast and great and are adorned with assemblies of bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang 'khor gyi tshogs de dang de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la bdag gi so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i spyod yul gyi gtam dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i chos tshig dang rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang 'khor gyi tshogs de dang de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la bdag gi so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i spyod yul gyi gtam dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i chos tshig dang rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul dang /
translated: Those lord buddhas in those assemblies teach the bodhisattva great beings the Dharma discourse that is the domain of realization with their own individual ārya wisdom, and the Dharma that is the domain of the object of seeing, the object of words and concepts,

original: yi ge dang bral ba de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i phyi ma'i mtha'i mur 'dug @6a *//
analyzed: yi ge dang bral ba de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i phyi ma'i mtha'i mur 'dug @6a *//
translated: and the object of the domain of the absence of letters, suchness, the limit of reality, and the attainment of nirvāṇa.🔽They teach the ultimate limit that is the end.

original: par ston / de ni rnam par bkod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston te /
analyzed: par ston / de ni rnam par bkod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston te /
translated: That is the correct teaching of the arrangement.

original: de ni gang rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa khyod kyis 'di'i pha rol na 'jig rten gzhan dang sangs rgyas dag yod dam zhes smras pa de'i lan du ngas 'di smras so //
analyzed: de ni gang rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa khyod kyis 'di'i pha rol na 'jig rten gzhan dang sangs rgyas dag yod dam zhes smras pa de'i lan du ngas 'di smras so //
translated: I have said this in reply to your question, “Is there another world beyond this, and are there Buddhas?”

original: rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa khyod 'ba' zhig sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / byang chub sems dpa' la ltad mo blta bar 'dod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la dri bar sems par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa khyod 'ba' zhig sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / byang chub sems dpa' la ltad mo blta bar 'dod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la dri bar sems par ma zad kyi /
translated: “You alone, O Teacher of the Truth, wish to see the adornments of the Buddha-fields and the Bodhisattvas. You think to question the Tathagata about this, but you are not alone in this.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shugs 'dzin 'di'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgra'i dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / spyi gtsug tshad med pa la ltad mo blta bar 'dod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba stong phrag brgyar song nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed du rdzu 'phrul gyi mchog gis gyen du song yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shugs 'dzin 'di'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgra'i dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / spyi gtsug tshad med pa la ltad mo blta bar 'dod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba stong phrag brgyar song nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed du rdzu 'phrul gyi mchog gis gyen du song yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva Vegadhārin, in order to behold the adornments of the buddha realms of the blessed buddhas, the maṇḍala of the sound of the buddhas’ voices, and their immeasurable uṣṇīṣas, has gone to a hundred thousand quintillion buddha realms. He has gone up to as many buddha realms as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River through the supreme miraculous power of a bodhisattva, but he has not seen the adornments of the buddha realm of the blessed thus-gone Śākyamuni.

original: po shugs 'dzin 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa gcig tsam gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan tam /
analyzed: po shugs 'dzin 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa gcig tsam gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan tam /
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva Vegadhārin has gone to a hundred thousand quintillion buddha realms in order to behold the display of the buddha realms of the blessed buddhas, the maṇḍala of the sound of the buddhas’ voices, and the immeasurable uṣṇīṣas. He has gone up to as many buddha realms as there are sand grains in the Ganges River with his supreme miraculous powers, but this bodhisattva mahāsattva Vegadhārin has not seen even the display of the buddha realm of a single thus-gone one,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor ram /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor ram /
translated: nor the maṇḍala of the sound of the buddhas’ voices,

original: spyi gtsug tshad med pa'ang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: spyi gtsug tshad med pa'ang ma mthong ste /
translated: nor the immeasurable uṣṇīṣas.

original: des ma mthong @6b ba dang / ngo mtshar du gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / spyi gtsug ltar tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang dag par rjes su dran zhing mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nyid du phyin nas mnyan du yod par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug ste /
analyzed: des ma mthong @6b ba dang / ngo mtshar du gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / spyi gtsug ltar tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang dag par rjes su dran zhing mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nyid du phyin nas mnyan du yod par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug ste /
translated: Not seeing him, he was amazed and remembered the inconceivable, immeasurable, and boundless circle of the Buddha’s speech and crown protrusion. He arrived in this very Sahā world realm and sat in the presence of the Blessed Buddha in Śrāvastī.

original: nyes pa la nyes par bshags nas sangs rgyas rnams nam mkha' dang mnyam par shes te mngon par bstod nas /
analyzed: nyes pa la nyes par bshags nas sangs rgyas rnams nam mkha' dang mnyam par shes te mngon par bstod nas /
translated: He confessed his faults as faults and understood the buddhas to be equal to space. He praised them

original: bdag gi so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i spyod yul la mngon par mos shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po nyid du song ste gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: bdag gi so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i spyod yul la mngon par mos shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po nyid du song ste gnas par gyur to //
translated: and became intent on the domain of realization through his own noble wisdom. He went to the buddhafield of the Dense Array and remained there.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po sa dang sa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa phra ba dang / dmigs su phebs pa dang / rnam par gdon mi za ba'i gtam zlos pa stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po sa dang sa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa phra ba dang / dmigs su phebs pa dang / rnam par gdon mi za ba'i gtam zlos pa stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: thorough, and definitive, rose from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar bas phyag btsal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar bas phyag btsal te /
translated: With palms joined he bowed to the Blessed One

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyogs gcig bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la zhu ba zhus pa lung bstan @7a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyogs gcig bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la zhu ba zhus pa lung bstan @7a *//
translated: “Blessed One,

original: pa'i slad du skabs dbye bar gnang na bdag gis zhu'o //
analyzed: pa'i slad du skabs dbye bar gnang na bdag gis zhu'o //
translated: if the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One would allow me the opportunity to request an explanation of a few points, I would like to ask some questions.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Vajra garbha,

original: rdo rje'i snying po khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la dris shig dang / ngas ci dang ci 'dod pa de dang de'i dri ba dris pa lung bstan pas sems mgu bar bya'i /
analyzed: rdo rje'i snying po khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la dris shig dang / ngas ci dang ci 'dod pa de dang de'i dri ba dris pa lung bstan pas sems mgu bar bya'i /
translated: I will satisfy your mind by answering whatever questions you may have.

original: khyod kyis ji ltar bzod pa de ltar smros shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis ji ltar bzod pa de ltar smros shig /
translated: Speak as much as you can bear.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po la bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs phye nas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po la bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs phye nas /
translated: Having been thus addressed, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, Vajra garbha, having been given leave by the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: addressed the Lord as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavan,

original: sangs rgyas sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba dang / 'tshang rgya bar bgyi ba zhes bya ba'i don ci lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba dang / 'tshang rgya bar bgyi ba zhes bya ba'i don ci lags /
translated: what is the meaning of ‘buddha’ and ‘to become enlightened’?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavan,

original: don dam pa 'phags pa'i yul chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi rigs ston pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba'i spyod pa'i sa la spyod pa dang / gzugs dang / mtshan nyid dang / yang dag par bsdu ba'i lta bar ltung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: don dam pa 'phags pa'i yul chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi rigs ston pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba'i spyod pa'i sa la spyod pa dang / gzugs dang / mtshan nyid dang / yang dag par bsdu ba'i lta bar ltung ba rnams dang /
translated: the views that fall into form, characteristics, and correct compilation,🔽the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,

original: mur 'dug gzhan gyi smra ba la mngon par chags pa'i blo'i spyod yul la spyod pa rnams dang / rdul dang / gces pa dang / dbang po dang / phyogs dang / dus dang / @7b nam mkha' dang / bdag dang / yid dang / dbang po dang /
analyzed: mur 'dug gzhan gyi smra ba la mngon par chags pa'i blo'i spyod yul la spyod pa rnams dang / rdul dang / gces pa dang / dbang po dang / phyogs dang / dus dang / @7b nam mkha' dang / bdag dang / yid dang / dbang po dang /
translated: the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,

original: don nye bar 'du ba'i lta bar ltung ba rnams kyi blo rnam par bzlog pa'i slad du bshad du gsol /🔽bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: don nye bar 'du ba'i lta bar ltung ba rnams kyi blo rnam par bzlog pa'i slad du bshad du gsol / bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,🔽the views that fall into the objects of experience of the mind that is attached to the assertions of others,

original: bstan du gsol /
analyzed: bstan du gsol /
translated: the views that fall into the

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las dang / mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / de la skye ba'i yid la byed pa dang / gsum 'du ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa can dang / rgyu dang / de ma thag pa dang /🔽dbang dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa la chags par spyod pa dang / yod pa dang / med par smra ba'i rtog pa can dang / chos 'di pa'i phung po dang / gang zag stong pa nyid du lta bar lhung ba rnams kyi'ang blo rnam par bzlog pa'i slad du; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las dang / mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / de la skye ba'i yid la byed pa dang / gsum 'du ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa can dang / rgyu dang / de ma thag pa dang / dbang dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa la chags par spyod pa dang / yod pa dang / med par smra ba'i rtog pa can dang / chos 'di pa'i phung po dang / gang zag stong pa nyid du lta bar lhung ba rnams kyi'ang blo rnam par bzlog pa'i slad du; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ignorance, craving, action, the eye, form, light, mental activity that arises in dependence on that, consciousness that is conceptual thought that arises from the coming together of the three, cause, immediate [condition],🔽the dominant [condition], and the objective [condition], and who engage in attachment to consciousness, who have the concepts of existence and nonexistence, and who have fallen into the views of emptiness of the aggregates and the person of this Dharma—

original: bstan du gsol /
analyzed: bstan du gsol /
translated: Blessed One, please teach the Dharma in order to turn back their minds.

original: chos kyi dbang po thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi dbang po thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: They will attain the power of the Dharma.

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Sugata,

original: bstan du gsol //
analyzed: bstan du gsol //
translated: please teach.

original: rnam shes lnga yi rgyu la sogs //
analyzed: rnam shes lnga yi rgyu la sogs //
translated: The causes of the five consciousnesses and so on,

original: mnga' bdag dam pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: mnga' bdag dam pa ma gtogs par //
translated: except for the supreme lord,

original: sangs rgyas blo dang shes bya dang // ji ltar gang gis 'tshang rgya zhing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas blo dang shes bya dang // ji ltar gang gis 'tshang rgya zhing //
translated: How and by what one awakens,

original: shes bya rnam pa lnga po rnams //
analyzed: shes bya rnam pa lnga po rnams //
translated: The five aspects of the knowable,

original: thugs su chud pa sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: thugs su chud pa sangs rgyas te //
translated: The one who has realized these is the Buddha.

original: chos rnams thams cad mkhyen pas na //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad mkhyen pas na //
translated: Because he knows all phenomena,

original: mya ngan 'das dang mnyam gshegs pa //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das dang mnyam gshegs pa //
translated: He is equal to nirvana.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: dge'o // rdo rje'i snying po /
analyzed: dge'o // rdo rje'i snying po /
translated: Excellent, Vajra Heart!

original: sa bcu la @8a *//
analyzed: sa bcu la @8a *//
translated: On the ten grounds,

original: dbang ba / rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul las 'das pa /
analyzed: dbang ba / rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul las 'das pa /
translated: having power over, beyond the realm of conceptual activity,

original: mkhas pa chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi rigs grags par byed pa dge'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi rigs grags par byed pa dge'o //
translated: the wise one's natural buddha-potential is proclaimed to be excellent.

original: rnal 'byor dam pa la dbang pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor dam pa la dbang pa /
translated: In the supreme yoga, having power over,

original: sangs rgyas dang 'tshang rgya bar yongs su dri ba 'di la ni khyod 'ba' zhig ltad mo byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang 'tshang rgya bar yongs su dri ba 'di la ni khyod 'ba' zhig ltad mo byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: in this inquiry into the Buddha and awakening, you alone are not the only one who has become curious.

original: sgyu ma byed pa bzang po dang / rgyal ba'i bu gzhan dag kyang don 'di la ltad mo byung zhing sangs rgyas kyi dngos po 'dri ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma byed pa bzang po dang / rgyal ba'i bu gzhan dag kyang don 'di la ltad mo byung zhing sangs rgyas kyi dngos po 'dri ste /
translated: Other sons of the Victorious One, excellent magicians, have become curious about this matter and inquire into the nature of the Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don 'di ci zhig /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don 'di ci zhig /
translated: What is the meaning of the word “Tathāgata”?

original: ci gzugs de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: ci gzugs de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: Is the Tathāgata form,

original: 'on te gzugs las gzhan zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs las gzhan zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: or is the Tathāgata other than form?

original: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi 'du byed las kyang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi 'du byed las kyang ste /
translated: And so on up to: Is the Tathāgata conditioned phenomena such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases?

original: nang dang phyi'i mnyam pa nyid kyang mi mthong zhing byas pa'i rgyu dang 'jig pa'i chos can gyi phyir phung po rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa med de /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i mnyam pa nyid kyang mi mthong zhing byas pa'i rgyu dang 'jig pa'i chos can gyi phyir phung po rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa med de /
translated: The Tathāgata is not in the aggregates, because he does not see the sameness of the internal and external, and because the aggregates are subject to creation and destruction.

original: rdul phra mo med pa thugs su chud pa'i phyir shes rab dang / ye shes dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul te /
analyzed: rdul phra mo med pa thugs su chud pa'i phyir shes rab dang / ye shes dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul te /
translated: The Tathāgata is the object of the wisdom, knowledge, and concentration of one who has realized the absence of subtle particles.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i thugs kyi yang dag par rjes su ma gzigs shing /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i thugs kyi yang dag par rjes su ma gzigs shing /
translated: He is not seen by the mind in meditative equipoise.

original: phung po rnams skyes pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku yin pas na rtag pa nyid do snyam mo //
analyzed: phung po rnams skyes pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku yin pas na rtag pa nyid do snyam mo //
translated: The Tathāgata is the dharma body of the arising of the aggregates, and therefore he is permanent.”

original: kye rgyal ba'i bu /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i bu /
translated: “O son of noble family!

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi shin tu phye ba la mkhas pa de dge'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi shin tu phye ba la mkhas pa de dge'o //
translated: It is good to be skilled in the discernment of the realm of phenomena.

original: kye rgyal ba'i bu //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i bu //
translated: “O son of noble family!

original: de bas na dge bar shin tu nyon te yid la gyis shig dang ngas khyod @8b bshad do //🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de bas na dge bar shin tu nyon te yid la gyis shig dang ngas khyod @8b bshad do // bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Therefore, listen well and keep it in mind. I will explain it to you.”🔽“Excellent, Blessed One!”

original: dge'o zhes nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po bcom ldan 'das las phyir nyan to //
analyzed: dge'o zhes nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po bcom ldan 'das las phyir nyan to //
translated: replied the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajra garbha, and he listened to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to him,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i snying po ting nge 'dzin la dbang pa rdo rje'i snying po phung po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i snying po ting nge 'dzin la dbang pa rdo rje'i snying po phung po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin /
translated: the vajra essence of the vajra essence samādhi is not the thus-gone ones,

original: phung po las gzhan na yang med de; phung po la gnas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: phung po las gzhan na yang med de; phung po la gnas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: nor is it other than the aggregates, nor does it abide in the aggregates,

original: phung po'ang gnas ma yin /
analyzed: phung po'ang gnas ma yin /
translated: nor are the aggregates its abode,

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'ang gnas ma yin /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'ang gnas ma yin /
translated: nor is it the abode of arising and ceasing,

original: shes par bya ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: shes par bya ba'ang ma yin /
translated: nor is it the object of knowledge,

original: shes pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: shes pa'ang ma yin /
translated: nor is it knowledge,

original: don kyang ma yin; dbang po rnams kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: don kyang ma yin; dbang po rnams kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it the meaning, nor is it the faculties.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / yul rnams ni ma no bsam med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / yul rnams ni ma no bsam med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the aggregates, elements, sense spheres, and objects are not the Thus-Gone One.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'di rnams las nang dam phyir yang mi blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'di rnams las nang dam phyir yang mi blta'o //
translated: The Thus-Gone One is not seen as being within or without these.

original: gzugs ni spyod pa med cing sems med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni spyod pa med cing sems med pa ste /
translated: Form is without action and without mind.

original: 'byung ba med pa'i chos can /
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa'i chos can /
translated: It is a phenomenon without origination,

original: mthar 'jig pa /🔽rtsva dang shing dang por rdo dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: mthar 'jig pa / rtsva dang shing dang por rdo dang 'dra ba /
translated: ending in destruction.🔽It is like grass, trees, walls, tiles, and pebbles.

original: shin tu phra ba'i rdul gyi tshogs dbu ba dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i rdul gyi tshogs dbu ba dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The collection of subtle atoms is like foam.

original: tshor ba ni gnyis tshogs pa las chu'i chu bur dang 'dra bar skye'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni gnyis tshogs pa las chu'i chu bur dang 'dra bar skye'o //
translated: Sensation arises from the combination of two factors, like a water bubble.

original: 'du shes ni bum pa dang / snam bu dang / cod pan la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'du shes ni bum pa dang / snam bu dang / cod pan la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: Perception arises from causes such as a pot, a cloth, a crown, and so forth.

original: de'ang gnyis las skyes pa'i smig rgyu dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de'ang gnyis las skyes pa'i smig rgyu dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: It is like a mirage, arising from two factors.

original: dper na / dpyid kyis mngon par gdungs pa'i sa la nyi ma'i 'od zer bab @9a *//
analyzed: dper na / dpyid kyis mngon par gdungs pa'i sa la nyi ma'i 'od zer bab @9a *//
translated: For example, when the earth is scorched by the summer heat, the light of the sun

original: pa gyen du langs pa rnams chu'i rlabs lta bur rlab cing ri dvags dang bya skom gyis nyen cing chu 'tshol ba rnams la chur rmongs par bya bas rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: pa gyen du langs pa rnams chu'i rlabs lta bur rlab cing ri dvags dang bya skom gyis nyen cing chu 'tshol ba rnams la chur rmongs par bya bas rmongs par byed do //
translated: The mountains that rise up high are like waves on the water. The animals and birds that are tormented by thirst and seek water are deceived by the mirage, which appears to them as water.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes kyang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes kyang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa /
translated: In the same way, perception is not of the nature of form,

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i gzugs su 'jug pa /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i gzugs su 'jug pa /
translated: but is engaged with what is not of its own nature,

original: yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su brtags pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su brtags pa las skyes pa /
translated: which arises from the imagination of what is unreal,

original: dpyod pa rnams kyis brjod pa las logs shig tu mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: dpyod pa rnams kyis brjod pa las logs shig tu mi dmigs pa //
translated: and is not perceived separately from the expressions of thought by those who investigate.

original: bong bu'i rva dang / mo gsham gyi bu brjod pa ltar ming tsam du zad pa ste /
analyzed: bong bu'i rva dang / mo gsham gyi bu brjod pa ltar ming tsam du zad pa ste /
translated: It is just a name, like the expression “the horn of a donkey” or “the son of a barren woman.”

original: rmi lam gyi gzugs brjod pa ltar blta'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gzugs brjod pa ltar blta'o //
translated: It should be seen as just a verbal expression, like the form in a dream.

original: dper na / rmi lam na gzugs kyi 'du shes mthong ba sad pa'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa dang / bud med bzang mo'ang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: dper na / rmi lam na gzugs kyi 'du shes mthong ba sad pa'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa dang / bud med bzang mo'ang dmigs su med do //
translated: For example, when one who has seen the perception of form in a dream awakens, neither the form nor the beautiful woman is perceived.

original: de bzhin du mi shes pas log pa na bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa mthong ba'ang mngon par sangs rgyas na mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi shes pas log pa na bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa mthong ba'ang mngon par sangs rgyas na mi dmigs so //
translated: In the same way, when the ignorant see a woman or a man, they see them as real. But when they are fully enlightened, they do not see them.

original: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing gi snying po lta bu ste btsal na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing gi snying po lta bu ste btsal na /
translated: Formations are like the core of a plantain tree.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid las byung ba gzugs med pa rnams rnal 'byor can gyi dpyod pa pa rnams kyis mi rnyed do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid las byung ba gzugs med pa rnams rnal 'byor can gyi dpyod pa pa rnams kyis mi rnyed do //
translated: When you search for the formless mental factors that arise from body, speech, and mind, the yogis and yoginīs do not find them.

original: rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu de'i bdag nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu de'i bdag nyid med pa ste /
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion. It does not have an essence.

original: sgyu ma byed pa'am /
analyzed: sgyu ma byed pa'am /
translated: A magician or

original: de'i slob mas nan tan du rtsva dang shing dang bong rdo tsam la brten te /
analyzed: de'i slob mas nan tan du rtsva dang shing dang bong rdo tsam la brten te /
translated: his apprentice, using just a little grass, wood, or stone,

original: gzugs kyi yan lag du ma @9b las mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sgyu ma'i gzugs glang po dang / rta dang / shing rta dang / mi dang / rgyan ma brtags pa'i gzugs kyi phyogs gcig ngo mtshar du bstan pa lta bu dang / gzhan yang mkhas pa rnams la ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs kyi yan lag du ma @9b las mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sgyu ma'i gzugs glang po dang / rta dang / shing rta dang / mi dang / rgyan ma brtags pa'i gzugs kyi phyogs gcig ngo mtshar du bstan pa lta bu dang / gzhan yang mkhas pa rnams la ma yin gyi /
translated: creates an illusory form that is made up of many parts. The form of the illusion may be that of an elephant, a horse, a chariot, a man, or a woman. The form of the illusion is taught as a single example of a form that is not real.

original: bus pa'i 'gro ba rnams la 'drid pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'ang rnam pa gzhan du 'dug la /
analyzed: bus pa'i 'gro ba rnams la 'drid pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'ang rnam pa gzhan du 'dug la /
translated: Just as a magician conjures up a variety of things for the sake of childish beings, in the same way consciousness also appears in different ways.

original: rnam pa gzhan du shin tu brtags shing shin tu rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du shin tu brtags shing shin tu rtog ste /
translated: It is thoroughly examined and thoroughly understood in different ways.

original: de'ang bdag nyid kyis bdag la 'dzin pa gnyis su shes nas /
analyzed: de'ang bdag nyid kyis bdag la 'dzin pa gnyis su shes nas /
translated: Moreover, having understood the two kinds of self-grasping,

original: sgyu mas mngon par grub pa'i gzugs gcig po'i ngo mtshar dang 'dra bar phyir ldog pa /
analyzed: sgyu mas mngon par grub pa'i gzugs gcig po'i ngo mtshar dang 'dra bar phyir ldog pa /
translated: one turns away from the wonder of a single form that is established by illusion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa /
translated: The Tathāgata is permanent,

original: brtan pa / ther zug /
analyzed: brtan pa / ther zug /
translated: stable, and eternal,

original: mi 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'jig pa ste /
translated: and indestructible.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor can rnams kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor can rnams kyi yul yin te /
translated: He is the object of those who are yogis who cultivate the meditation of recollecting the Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bsgrags pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang / nam mkha' lta bur mi 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bsgrags pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang / nam mkha' lta bur mi 'jig pa ste /
translated: The essence of the Tathāgata, proclaimed as the realm of nirvāṇa, is indestructible like space.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgra chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig gis 'das pa dang / byung ba dang / 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bstan te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgra chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig gis 'das pa dang / byung ba dang / 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bstan te /
translated: The word “nirvāṇa” is taught by the blessed buddhas who have appeared, are appearing, and will appear in the future, using the words of the dharmadhātu.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /🔽ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung / ma byung yang rung /
translated: Thus, whether the tathāgatas appear or not,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos skyon med pa gnyis pa 'di ni de bzhin gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos skyon med pa gnyis pa 'di ni de bzhin gnas pa'o //
translated: this reality of phenomena, this abiding nature of phenomena, this dharmadhātu, this faultlessness of phenomena, this suchness,🔽this non-otherness, this non-differentiation, this non-differentiation in any way whatsoever,🔽this is the very same.

original: rdo rje'i snying po /🔽skyon med pa zhes bya @10a *//
analyzed: rdo rje'i snying po / skyon med pa zhes bya @10a *//
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: ba ni yang 'byung ba'i nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ba ni yang 'byung ba'i nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: faultlessness is free from all the faults of arising.

original: rdo rje'i snying po //
analyzed: rdo rje'i snying po //
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: skyon med pa ni nyes pa thams cad dang bral bar ma zad kyi ting nge 'dzin la'ang 'jug go //
analyzed: skyon med pa ni nyes pa thams cad dang bral bar ma zad kyi ting nge 'dzin la'ang 'jug go //
translated: faultlessness is not only free from all faults, but it also enters into samādhi.🔽Vajrapāṇi,

original: skyon med par 'da' ba ni byang chub sems dpas spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: skyon med par 'da' ba ni byang chub sems dpas spang bar bya ste /
translated: faultlessness is to be abandoned by the bodhisattvas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo de nyid du myos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo de nyid du myos te /
translated: In this way, they become intoxicated by that very gateway of samādhi.

original: sems can la lta ba med par gyur cing yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byas nas lcags bsregs pa'i me dang 'dra bar mya ngan las 'da' bar gyur te /
analyzed: sems can la lta ba med par gyur cing yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byas nas lcags bsregs pa'i me dang 'dra bar mya ngan las 'da' bar gyur te /
translated: Without regard for sentient beings, they actualize the limit of reality and attain nirvāṇa, which is like a red-hot iron that cools down.

original: de sems can gyi dgos pa la brtson 'grus btang zhing snying rje chen po dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang bral bas sangs rgyas kyi gdung rnam par chad par byed cing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas mur 'dug byed pa'i lam du 'gro ste /
analyzed: de sems can gyi dgos pa la brtson 'grus btang zhing snying rje chen po dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang bral bas sangs rgyas kyi gdung rnam par chad par byed cing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas mur 'dug byed pa'i lam du 'gro ste /
translated: They abandon their efforts to benefit sentient beings and, because they are devoid of great compassion and the perfections, they cause the lineage of the buddhas to be interrupted and they proceed on the path of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'dam du glang po che chen po 'dra bar rnam par thogs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'dam du glang po che chen po 'dra bar rnam par thogs te /
translated: They are caught in the mud of samādhi, like a great elephant.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul rab tu zhum pas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi skye mched thams cad kyis kun nas mi gnas shing rdzogs par mi byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir mngon du mi bya zhing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul rab tu zhum pas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi skye mched thams cad kyis kun nas mi gnas shing rdzogs par mi byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir mngon du mi bya zhing /
translated: Because the objects of consciousness have become extremely feeble, they do not actualize the entire range of the buddhadharmas and do not complete them.

original: ma reg pa dang / nye bar mi bsgrub par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: ma reg pa dang / nye bar mi bsgrub par gnas par bya'o //
translated: They should remain without touching and without establishing anything.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku'i rjes su zhugs ste sangs rgyas kyi che ba nyid shes pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sangs rgyas rnam @10b pa sna tshogs kyi tshul gyi yul la nye bar spyod pa /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku'i rjes su zhugs ste sangs rgyas kyi che ba nyid shes pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sangs rgyas rnam @10b pa sna tshogs kyi tshul gyi yul la nye bar spyod pa /
translated: In this way, having entered into the dharmakāya of the buddhas, they understand the greatness of the buddhas and experience the domain of the various ways of the buddhas who turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: sprul pa'i yul can /
analyzed: sprul pa'i yul can /
translated: They are the objects of emanations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin las bslang ba'i sbyor ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin las bslang ba'i sbyor ba /
translated: They are the ones who are to be roused from their samādhi by the tathāgatas.

original: sa brgyad pa las 'das pa /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa las 'das pa /
translated: They have transcended the eighth bhūmi.

original: chos kyi sprin gyi sa la shes par rab tu byas pa /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin gyi sa la shes par rab tu byas pa /
translated: They have been made to understand the bhūmi of the cloud of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi che ba nyid myong nas de bzhin gshegs pa bdag gi so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i spyod yul gyi sar zhugs te thams cad du 'gro ba ma g-yos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spyod pa /🔽lhun gyis grub pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi che ba nyid myong nas de bzhin gshegs pa bdag gi so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i spyod yul gyi sar zhugs te thams cad du 'gro ba ma g-yos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spyod pa / lhun gyis grub pa /
translated: Having experienced the greatness of the buddhas, they enter the bhūmi that is the domain of the realization of the tathāgatas’ own individual awareness through the wisdom of the āryas and experience the samādhi that goes everywhere without moving.🔽They are spontaneously present,

original: rtag pa / ther zug pa /
analyzed: rtag pa / ther zug pa /
translated: permanent, and stable.

original: brtan pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po na gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtan pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po na gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: The stable ones will dwell in the Buddha-field of Ghanavyūha.

original: rdo rje'i dbang po sa la dbang ba rnams la 'phrul pa'i 'jug pa ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dbang po sa la dbang ba rnams la 'phrul pa'i 'jug pa ston par 'gyur te /
translated: The vajra lords, who have power over the earth, will display their magical activity.

original: gnas gyur pa /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa /
translated: They will have attained the transformation

original: yid bzhin gyi ye shes dang ting nge 'dzin can /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi ye shes dang ting nge 'dzin can /
translated: of the wisdom and samādhi of the wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: stobs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang la spyod pa /
analyzed: stobs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang la spyod pa /
translated: They will have power over the strengths, superknowledges, magical powers, and the bases of miraculous ability.

original: ngang pa'i rgyal po dang 'dra bar ma zhugs pa'i chu'i zla ba lta bur 'gro ste /
analyzed: ngang pa'i rgyal po dang 'dra bar ma zhugs pa'i chu'i zla ba lta bur 'gro ste /
translated: They will move like the king of geese, like the moon reflected in water.

original: blta ba'i don yod pa /
analyzed: blta ba'i don yod pa /
translated: They will have the purpose of being seen.

original: mi'i bdag po thams cad kyi tshogs kyi 'khor du sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta bur 'dod pa'i gzugs dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po bstan pa'i phyir sems can gyi bsam pa bzhin du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'i bdag po thams cad kyi tshogs kyi 'khor du sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta bur 'dod pa'i gzugs dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing stug po bstan pa'i phyir sems can gyi bsam pa bzhin du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the retinue of the assembly of all the lords of humans, they will enter according to the wishes of sentient beings, with forms that they desire, in order to teach the Buddha-field of Ghanavyūha.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang po thams cad dang / dbang sgyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @11a *//
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang po thams cad dang / dbang sgyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @11a *//
translated: All the faculties of the desire realm,

original: chen po nor bu rin po che'i snying po la sogs pa'i gnas dag tu bde ba rnams myong bar byas te /
analyzed: chen po nor bu rin po che'i snying po la sogs pa'i gnas dag tu bde ba rnams myong bar byas te /
translated: and the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have mastery, such as Ratnagarbha, in the abodes of happiness,

original: sa'i rim pa rnams bstan nas zhing nas zhing du phun sum bde ba rnams rab tu ston cing phyi ma'i mthar thug par bsku ba grub pa'i sngags 'chang ltar mi snang zhing /
analyzed: sa'i rim pa rnams bstan nas zhing nas zhing du phun sum bde ba rnams rab tu ston cing phyi ma'i mthar thug par bsku ba grub pa'i sngags 'chang ltar mi snang zhing /
translated: having shown the stages of the earth, display the perfections from field to field, and like accomplished mantra-holders, do not appear until the end of time.

original: khang khyim gyi lha ltar de na gnas bzhin du mi snang ba'i gzugs su khyim na 'dug pa ltar de dag sprul pa'i 'od zer dang / 'phrul bas sprul pa la spyod cing 'gro'o //
analyzed: khang khyim gyi lha ltar de na gnas bzhin du mi snang ba'i gzugs su khyim na 'dug pa ltar de dag sprul pa'i 'od zer dang / 'phrul bas sprul pa la spyod cing 'gro'o //
translated: Like the gods of the house, while dwelling there, they do not appear in invisible forms, like those dwelling in the house. They move by the light rays of emanation and the emanations of emanation.

original: song nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku nub ste /
analyzed: song nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku nub ste /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la zhen nas gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: occurs, and they will dwell attached to the body of the Tathāgata.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses:

original: dbang po phung po sprul yin te //
analyzed: dbang po phung po sprul yin te //
translated: The aggregates are emanations of the faculties,

original: sred dang ma rig las kyang yin //
analyzed: sred dang ma rig las kyang yin //
translated: Craving and ignorance,

original: bag chags kyis bcings mi bzad pa //
analyzed: bag chags kyis bcings mi bzad pa //

original: yul dang dbang po'i rgyu las byung //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po'i rgyu las byung //

original: rnam dpyod tshogs ni 'dod chags rnams //
analyzed: rnam dpyod tshogs ni 'dod chags rnams //
translated: The assemblies of analysis are the various attachments,

original: zhags pa sems bskyed de yin no //
analyzed: zhags pa sems bskyed de yin no //
translated: The fetters of the mind.

original: khro ba me lce mnyam pa ste //
analyzed: khro ba me lce mnyam pa ste //
translated: Anger is like a flame of fire,

original: zhe sdang dug gi dngos po yin //
analyzed: zhe sdang dug gi dngos po yin //
translated: Hatred is a poisonous substance.

original: thub spyod rnal 'byor bzang can gyis //
analyzed: thub spyod rnal 'byor bzang can gyis //
translated: Those of good yoga, who practice the Sage's way,

original: 'di dag rtag tu rnam gzhigs te //
analyzed: 'di dag rtag tu rnam gzhigs te //
translated: Always analyze these things.

original: phung po rnams ni dor ba'i phyir //
analyzed: phung po rnams ni dor ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to abandon the aggregates,

original: rnal 'byor can gyis rnal 'byor spyod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can gyis rnal 'byor spyod //
translated: The yogis practice yoga.

original: gzugs ni 'byung ba'i tshogs yin te //
analyzed: gzugs ni 'byung ba'i tshogs yin te //
translated: Form is a collection of elements,

original: phung po lhag ma gzugs @11b med pa //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma gzugs @11b med pa //
translated: The remaining aggregates are formless.🔽Just as in a painting, a shadow, or a stump,

original: ji bzhin par snang ri mo dang // grib la sdong dum la sogs med //
analyzed: ji bzhin par snang ri mo dang // grib la sdong dum la sogs med //
translated: There is no real thing.🔽Just as in space, the form of wind is invisible,

original: mkha' la rlung gzugs mi snang dang // bya yi rjes rnams ji bzhin ni //
analyzed: mkha' la rlung gzugs mi snang dang // bya yi rjes rnams ji bzhin ni //
translated: And like the traces of a bird,

original: mkhas pas so so rang rig pa //
analyzed: mkhas pas so so rang rig pa //
translated: The wise one’s individual self-awareness

original: yang dag nyid dang yang dag mtha'//
analyzed: yang dag nyid dang yang dag mtha'//

original: tshig gi spyod yul 'das pa ni //
analyzed: tshig gi spyod yul 'das pa ni //
translated: Beyond the domain of words,

original: sangs rgyas dngos po mi snang ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dngos po mi snang ste //

original: sangs rgyas sgras ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sgras ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: The word “buddha” is nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das kyang sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das kyang sangs rgyas te //
translated: Even in nirvana, there is buddhahood.

original: rnam rtog rtog dang bral bas na //
analyzed: rnam rtog rtog dang bral bas na //

original: de ni bstan du mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bstan du mi nus pa'o //

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa ste //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa ste //
translated: There is neither cause nor effect.

original: yod dang med kyis rnam par spangs //
analyzed: yod dang med kyis rnam par spangs //
translated: It is abandoned by existence and nonexistence.🔽When the chaff is ground to dust,

original: rngo ba phye mar btags pa la; ;gser ni yod par mi snang ste //
analyzed: rngo ba phye mar btags pa la; ;gser ni yod par mi snang ste //
translated: The gold is not apparent,

original: sbyang ba'i las kyi khyad par gyis //
analyzed: sbyang ba'i las kyi khyad par gyis //
translated: But through the special work of refining,

original: gser ni snang bar 'gyur pa yin //
analyzed: gser ni snang bar 'gyur pa yin //

original: gzugs rnams rdul du rnam gzhigs te //
analyzed: gzugs rnams rdul du rnam gzhigs te //
translated: When forms are analyzed into particles,🔽The wise one will see that the aggregates,🔽The elements, the sense bases,

original: mkhas pas phung po lhag ma dang // khams dang skye mched tshogs rnams dang // rnam par shes dang dbang po dag /
analyzed: mkhas pas phung po lhag ma dang // khams dang skye mched tshogs rnams dang // rnam par shes dang dbang po dag /

original: gcig dang tha dad dngos po yang //
analyzed: gcig dang tha dad dngos po yang //

original: rdul phran rnam par rab sbyangs na //
analyzed: rdul phran rnam par rab sbyangs na //

original: dngos por sangs rgyas yod pa min //
analyzed: dngos por sangs rgyas yod pa min //

original: sangs rgyas med pa'ang ma yin te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas med pa'ang ma yin te //
translated: Nor is there buddhahood in the absence of things.

original: rnal 'byor can rnams sangs rgyas mthong //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can rnams sangs rgyas mthong //

original: mtshan rab sum cu rtsa gnyis can //
analyzed: mtshan rab sum cu rtsa gnyis can //

original: gang na sdug bsngal de na bde //
analyzed: gang na sdug bsngal de na bde //

original: de nyid la ni snang ba yin //
analyzed: de nyid la ni snang ba yin //

original: sangs rgyas med ces mi bya ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas med ces mi bya ste //

original: sangs rgyas mnyam par bzhag pa yod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mnyam par bzhag pa yod //

original: rgyu yi sangs rgyas dge ba can //
analyzed: rgyu yi sangs rgyas dge ba can //

original: rtsa ba mkhas pa nyid kyang @12a *//
analyzed: rtsa ba mkhas pa nyid kyang @12a *//

original: ste; ;'jig rten kun gyi rgyal ba dang // yang dag rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang // 'di dag sangs rgyas lngar gsungs so //
analyzed: ste; ;'jig rten kun gyi rgyal ba dang // yang dag rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang // 'di dag sangs rgyas lngar gsungs so //

original: sprul pa'i rgyal ba lhag ma rnams //
analyzed: sprul pa'i rgyal ba lhag ma rnams //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yod //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yod //

original: mtshan rab sum cu rtsa gnyis can //
analyzed: mtshan rab sum cu rtsa gnyis can //

original: de bas sangs rgyas yod pa ste //
analyzed: de bas sangs rgyas yod pa ste //

analyzed: rnal 'byor can gyi thub pas mthong /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs kyi lha rdzas zhing //

original: rgyal sras bzang pos kun tu gang //
analyzed: rgyal sras bzang pos kun tu gang //

analyzed: de na thub chen sangs rgyas bzhugs //

original: mtshan gyis kun nas yongs su rgyas //
analyzed: mtshan gyis kun nas yongs su rgyas //

original: rnal 'byor rnal la mnyam par bzhag /
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnal la mnyam par bzhag /

original: chos dang bcas su rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: chos dang bcas su rnam par mdzes //

analyzed: de bzhin phan tshun bsam gtan mdzad //

analyzed: stug po de na rnam par spyod //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la rtag tu mos //
